concise_definition: v. 借出, 贷出 (lend 的过去式和过去分词)

definitions.explanation_en: To give something temporarily to someone with the expectation that it will be returned, especially money or an object.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指暂时将某物（尤其是金钱或物品）借给他人，期望对方日后归还。
definitions.example_en: She lent me her umbrella when it started raining.
definitions.example_cn: 天下雨时，她把伞借给了我。

definitions.explanation_en: To provide money as a loan, typically through a financial institution or formal agreement, often with interest.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过金融机构或正式协议提供贷款，通常带有利息。
definitions.example_en: The bank lent $50,000 to the small business to help it expand.
definitions.example_cn: 银行向这家小企业贷款五万美元，以帮助其扩张。

definitions.explanation_en: To give or offer something metaphorically, such as time, attention, or support.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指隐喻性地给予某物，如时间、注意力或支持。
definitions.example_en: He lent his voice to the cause of environmental protection.
definitions.example_cn: 他为环境保护事业发声。

comparison.analysis: “Borrow” (借入) 是从他人处获得某物并承诺归还，主语是接受方；而 “lent” 是主动将某物给予他人，主语是提供方。两者是相对动作，不可互换。例如：I borrowed a book from her. / She lent me a book.
“Loan” 是名词，指被借出的款项或物品本身，也可作动词（多用于金融语境），但口语中较少用作动词。而 “lent” 是 “lend” 的过去式，更常用于日常语言。例如：The bank gave a loan to the student. / The bank lent the student money.
“Rent” (租用) 指为使用某物（如房屋、车辆）而支付费用，通常有明确的期限和报酬，不强调归还，而是持续付费使用。而 “lent” 是无偿或基于信任的临时借用，一般不涉及金钱报酬。
